content.description: Crux is middle to 2/3 the way up the route.
content.protection: Always carry a set of nuts, mine are normal and offset, cams to 2"
content.location: Start 10 feet to right of Alley Oop (indicated by bolt/hanger with wingnut).  Go up past small pine tree and work up left side slab/face and crack to chain anchor.

content.description: The crux, in my opinion, is the traverse into the offwidth, then good pro to the top.
content.protection: Stoppers, cams and slings will get you up this thing.
content.location: Route is the furthest to the right on the wall.

content.description: Slab and face climb over a bulge or two.  Bolts protect the crux moves.
content.protection: 2 bolts and gear. 2 bolt anchor on top.
content.location: Farthest route to the right. The first bolt is 2/3 up the slab on the steeper face.

content.description: Work broken dihedral system and ledges to awesome hand crack, lots of variations down low then work to the right into crack. For me, the crux was just before the chain anchors.
content.location: To the left of Pterodactyl, can top rope and good for starting climbers and kiddos.

content.description: The crux is the start and the finishing moves.  Good protection.
content.protection: 3 bolts and gear, set of offset nuts and cams to 3"
content.location: Can't mistake the route with a wingnut to fix the hanger to the bolt
